verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>,
I have heard <S%H8085><s%> many such things <S%H7227><s%>: miserable <S%H5999><s%> comforters are you all <S%H5162><s%>.
Shall vain <S%H7307><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> have an end <S%H7093><s%>? or what emboldens <S%H4834><s%> you that you answer <S%H6030><s%>?

I also could speak <S%H1696><s%> as you do <S%H3863><s%>: if your soul <S%H5315><s%> were <S%H3426><s%> in my soul <S%H5315><s%>'s place <S%H2266><s%>, I could heap up words <S%H4405><s%> against you <S%H5128><s%>, and shake my head <S%H7218><s%> at you <S%H1119><s%>.
But I would strengthen <S%H553><s%> you with <S%H1119><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and the moving <S%H5205><s%> of my lips <S%H8193><s%> should assuage your grief <S%H2820><s%>.
Though I speak <S%H1696><s%>, my grief <S%H3511><s%> is not assuaged <S%H2820><s%>: and though I forbear <S%H2308><s%>, what am I eased <S%H1980><s%>?
But now he has made me weary <S%H3811><s%>: you have made desolate <S%H8074><s%> all my company <S%H5712><s%>.

And you have filled me with wrinkles <S%H7059><s%>, which is a witness <S%H5707><s%> against me <S%H3585><s%>: and my leanness rising up <S%H6965><s%> in me bears witness <S%H6030><s%> to my face <S%H6440><s%>.

He tears <S%H2963><s%> me in his wrath <S%H639><s%>, who hates <S%H7852><s%> me <S%H2786><s%>: he gnashes upon me with his teeth <S%H8127><s%>; my enemy <S%H6862><s%> sharpens <S%H3913><s%> his eyes upon me <S%H5869><s%>.

They have gaped <S%H6473><s%> upon me with their mouth <S%H6310><s%>; they have struck <S%H5221><s%> me upon the cheek <S%H3895><s%> reproachfully <S%H2781><s%>; they have gathered <S%H4390><s%> themselves together against me <S%H3162><s%>.
God <S%H410><s%> has delivered <S%H5462><s%> me to the ungodly <S%H5760><s%>, and turned me over <S%H3399><s%> into the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>.

I was at ease <S%H7961><s%>, but he has broken me asunder <S%H6565><s%>: he has also taken <S%H270><s%> me by my neck <S%H6203><s%>, and shaken me to pieces <S%H6327><s%>, and set me up <S%H6965><s%> for his mark <S%H4307><s%>.

His archers <S%H7228><s%> compass me round about <S%H5437><s%>, he cleaves <S%H6398><s%> my reins <S%H3629><s%> asunder <S%H6398><s%>, and does not spare <S%H2550><s%>; he pours out <S%H8210><s%> my gall <S%H4845><s%> upon the ground <S%H776><s%>.
He breaks <S%H6555><s%> me with breach <S%H6556><s%> upon <S%H6440><s%> breach <S%H6556><s%>, he runs <S%H7323><s%> upon me like a giant <S%H1368><s%>.
I have sewed <S%H8609><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> upon my skin <S%H1539><s%>, and defiled <S%H5953><s%> my horn <S%H7161><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>.
My face <S%H6440><s%> is foul <S%H2560><s%> with weeping <S%H1065><s%>, and on my eyelids <S%H6079><s%> is the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>;
Not for any injustice <S%H2555><s%> in my hands <S%H3709><s%>: also my prayer <S%H8605><s%> is pure <S%H2134><s%>.
O earth <S%H776><s%>, cover <S%H3680><s%> not you my blood <S%H1818><s%>, and let my cry <S%H2201><s%> have no place <S%H4725><s%>.
Also now <S%H5707><s%>, behold, my witness is in heaven <S%H8064><s%>, and my record <S%H7717><s%> is on high <S%H4791><s%>.
My friends <S%H7453><s%> scorn <S%H3887><s%> me <S%H5869><s%>: but my eye pours out <S%H1811><s%> tears unto God <S%H433><s%>.
O that one might plead <S%H3198><s%> for a man <S%H1397><s%> with God <S%H433><s%>, as a man <S%H120><s%> pleads for his neighbor <S%H1121><s%>!
When a few <S%H4557><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> are come <S%H857><s%>, then I shall go <S%H1980><s%> the way <S%H734><s%> from where I shall not return <S%H7725><s%>.
